For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: What do you wish to say?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: You don't obey the law of the creators.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
How can you understand
my world?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: That is a world of which Yonada is a part.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: You wish me to believe that Yonada is a ship?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: At night I see the stars.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Why should the (she gets a pain) Why should the truth wait for
you to come to Yonada?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Why should the truth be kept from us?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Why should the creators
keep us in darkness?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: No, you do not speak the truth.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: They said they spoke the truth.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Is truth not truth for all?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: I must know the truth of the world!

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Your friends have told me of your world.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: The creators kept us in darkness.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
And will they send this this ship again to the land the
creators intended?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: I do not fear the punishment of disobedience.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: No, I cannot go with you.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
I understand the
great purpose of the creators.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: I shall stay willingly, and because that is what I must do.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Will McCoy stay here to die?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
McCoy will not let go of life
and the fullness of years.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
You came here with a great mission to save
my people.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Perhaps one day, if it is permitted,
you will find Yonada again.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Then learn what it means to be our enemy before you learn what
it means to be our friend.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
He must become one of the people, worship the creators, and
agree to the insertion of the Instrument of Obedience.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: If he agrees to all things, it is permitted.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Teach him our laws
carefully so he commits no sacrilege, no offence against the people or
the creators.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Kirk and Spock have committed sacrilege.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
You know what must be
done.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
To become one of the people of Yonada, the Instrument of
Obedience must be made part of your flesh.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Do you now give your
consent?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Teach him, then, what he must know as one of the people.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
You have listened to the words of the
non-believers.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: You felt the pain of warning?

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: The truth of Yonada is your truth.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
There can be no other for
you.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: It is sacrilege to the temple.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: You are forbidden to gaze at the book.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: Many of us have felt the power of our Oracle.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
(he winces in pain) Many years ago I climbed
the mountains, even though it is forbidden.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text: (wince) But things are not as they teach us.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
For
the world is hollow, and I have touched the sky.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Captain Kirk, I sympathise
with your wish to stay, but I hope you recognise the necessity that you
continue your mission at once.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
You have been relieved of all responsibility for the
asteroid ship Yonada.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky
text:
Starfleet Command will take care of the
situation.

ep_title:
For
The World Is Hollow And I Have Touched The Sky

text: An entire human colony, a whole settlement.

One hundred men,
women and children.
We took no action against your ship, Kang.
There was a Federation colony on this planet.
Yes, a test of a new Klingon weapon, leaving no traces.
Federation ships don't specialise in sneak attacks.
I'll beam you aboard the Enterprise.
Beam up everyone in the target area.
Full security, Johnson, on the double.
I said no tricks after we reach the ship.

You're a prisoner of
the Federation of Planets against which you may or may not have
committed an act of war.
You wouldn't be standing here if I had.
Apparently you have a few things to learn about us.

Detain them
in the crew lounge.
Programme the food synthesiser to accommodate our guests.
Scan this sector for other ships.
Run a full check on the colony.
I want this thing nailed down fast.
No proof that Klingons committed it.
Unfortunately, there's no guarantee that they will be believed.
We've got a diplomatic tiger by the tail.

Mister Sulu, change course to seventeen mark four, warp factor
three.
That'll take us out of the galaxy.

Some
Klingons may have beamed aboard undetected from the wrecked ship.

Then
get down to Engineering and help Scotty hammer things back to normal.

(to Kang) And before I put you in the
brig, there's a little something I owe you.
They'll try to take the ship.
Scotty, how many men do we have?

Deploy forces to protect your section and the auxiliary control
centre.

Check the armoury, and try and free
those trapped crewmen.
Blow out the bulkheads if you have to.

What kind of luck have you had controlling the ship's
speed?
Full sensor scan of the ship.

Report on any
movement by the Klingons.

The Klingon Empire has maintained a duelling
tradition.
They think they can beat us with swords.

Take command of Engineering and auxiliary
control.
This is no time for a vendetta.
His only brother, killed in a Klingon raid.

Find Mister Chekov and bring him
to the bridge.
I don't know, but he does.

And now he wants revenge for a
non-existent loss.

Try to re-establish
engine control, and talk to ordnance about manufacturing phaser
replacements.
What the blazes is going on?
Could more Klingons have beamed aboard?

We must make contact, find out what it
wants.

A brother that never existed, a phantom colony, imaginary
distress calls, the creation of these weapons.

Do you sense a pattern,
Mister Spock?

And now it has control of the Enterprise and taking us out of the
galaxy.
We must talk to Kang, bury the hatchet.
The alien is the real threat.

That's the enemy we have to wipe
out.

Kang, there's something important I must
discuss with you.

(dictating into PADD) The Enterprise is heading out of our
galaxy, controlled by a mysterious alien somewhere aboard the ship.

Engineering has been taken over by Klingons who have cut off
life-support systems.
Get down to emergency manual control.

Try to protect our
life-support circuits and auxiliary power.
(intervenes as they nearly come to blows.)
What are we doing to each other?

It's never set us at each other's
throats.

We've been trained to think in
other terms than war.

We've been trained to fight its causes, if
necessary.
Then why are we behaving like a group of savages?

Two forces aboard this ship, each of them equally
armed.

Has a war been staged for us, complete with weapons and ideology
and patriotic drum beating?

(to Mara) There's an alien entity aboard the
ship.

We don't know what
its motive is.
A temporary truce, that's all I ask.

(picks him up) Is this what's in store for us,
from here on in?

So we can fight, and fight, and keep coming back for more
like some bloody coliseum?
What's next, the roar of crowds?

Maybe we can
prove to you that it exists.
Did McCoy release you from Sickbay?
It subsists on the emotions of others.
It exists on the hate of others.

And kept numbers and resources balanced, so that it can maintain
a constant state of violence.
It's got to have a vulnerable area.

We've
got to get rid of it.

Or we're a doomed ship, travelling forever between galaxies,
filled with eternal bloodlust, eternal warfare.
We've got to pool our knowledge and get rid of this thing.
And so we drift in space, with only hatred and bloodshed aboard.

If I could talk to Kang, somehow cut through the Klingon lines,
make peace before it's too late.

I know you can hear me, so don't cut me
off.
We talk truce now, or she dies.
She has five seconds to live.
The Federation doesn't kill or mistreat its prisoners.

You've
been listening to propaganda, fables.
We only wanted to stop the fighting to save us all.
We can't get through the Klingon defences in time, unless.
Intra-ship beaming from one section to another.
This is the only way out.

I hope your computations are correct, Mister
Spock.
Before you start killing, give me one minute.
Have any more of your men died?
For the rest of our lives.

Senseless violence, fighting, while an alien has total
control over us.
Next time I'll do the same to you.

And it goes on,
the good old game of war, pawn against pawn!

While somewhere, something sits back and laughs and starts it all over
again.

Be a pawn, be a toy, be a good soldier that never questions
orders.

We
know about you, and we don't want to play.

Maybe there are others like
you around.

Maybe you've caused a lot of suffering, a lot of history,
but that's all over.
We'll be on guard now, ready for you.

No evidence of a colony nor any residual
aftereffect of a force that might have annihilated it.
Which we were unable to detect upon approach.
My brother, you killed my brother.
Don't let these animals have the ship.
Captain, leave them where they are.

That's so
many less Klingon monsters in the galaxy.

They want to start a war by
pretending that we did.

I've got a personal score to settle with
the Klingons.
Don't try to stop me, Captain.

I saw what they left of Piotre,
and I swore on his grave I would avenge his murder.
You're not human, but you're very beautiful.

They said they were being attacked by an unidentified
ship.
Jim, you can't hand over the Enterprise.

The Klingons claim to have honoured the
truce, but there have been incidents, raids on our outposts.
We know what a Klingon is.
There are rules, even in war.

You
don't keep hacking at a man after he's down.

I've got men in Sickbay, some of them
dying.

Atrocities committed on their persons, and you talk about making
peace with these fiends?

If our backs were turned, they'd jump us in a
minute.
And you know what Klingons do to prisoners.
While you're talking, they're planning attacks.

This is a fight
to the death.
We'd better start trying to win it!
Who cares what started it, Mister Spock.
We should wipe out every one of them!

How many more men must die before you two begin to act like
military men instead of fools?
Brain waves show almost paranoid mania.
Johnson's heart wound is almost healed.

Sword wounds in the vital organs, massive trauma,
shock.
They're all healing at a fantastic rate.

Gentlemen, if we are pawns, you're looking at one who is
extremely sorry.

Sensors have picked up a Klingon ship,
closing fast.
Captain, the enemy ship is drifting, totally disabled.
And we never fired upon her.
Our landing party is intact, Doctor.
First group from the Klingon vessel, Captain.

At the moment we received the distress signal from the colony on
Beta Twelve A, the Klingons were too far distant to have been the
attackers.

Moreover, they also were apparently attracted by a distress
call.

Our log tapes will indicate our innocence in the present
situation.
Sensor sweeps reveal no other ships within range, Captain.

Captain, neither the Klingon technology nor ours, is capable of
this.

I doubt that they are
responsible.

However, if they had such power, would they not have used
it to create more effective weapons and only for themselves?

Scans indicate that our forces and those of the Klingons are
exactly equal at thirty eight each.

The Klingons control deck six and
starboard deck seven, while we control all sections above.

There appear to be more life-energy units
on board than can be accounted for by the presence of the Enterprise
crew plus the Klingons.
I shall attempt a compensatory reading of Klingon units.

It
is an alien life force, a single entity.
Readings being diverted to the library computer for analysis.

If the alien is creating these events, Captain, it is apparently
capable of manipulating matter and mind.

Captain, I am constrained to point out that since minds are
evidently being influenced, we cannot know at this moment whether our
own memories are completely accurate and true.

However, it is notoriously
difficult to arrange a truce with the Klingons once blood has been
drawn.
We are attempting to end it, Doctor.
There is an alien on board which may have created this situation.

May I say that I have not thoroughly enjoyed serving with
humans?
I find their illogic and foolish emotions a constant irritant.

Recent events would seem to be directed toward a magnification
of the basic hostilities between humans and Klingons.

Apparently, it is
by design that we fight.

It is most urgent that we locate the alien entity immediately,
and determine its motives and a method for halting its activities.

Alien detected in the engineering section,
near reactor number three.
It would appear that the entity wants us alive.

Perhaps human and Klingon psychologies and combat capabilities
are being tested by an alien with designs on both powers.

I, too, felt a brief surge of racial
bigotry.

During Lieutenant Johnson's emotional outburst, his
expression of hatred and lust for vengeance, the alien's life energy
level increased.

When the Lieutenant became unconscious, the alien lost
energy.

This one appears to be strengthened by mental irradiations of
hostility, violent intentions.

And it has acted as a catalyst, creating this
situation in order to satisfy that need.

It has brought together
opposing forces, provided crude instruments in an effort to promote the
most violent mode of conflict.
Then all hostile attitudes on board must be eliminated.

The
fighting must end and soon.
The alien is affecting his mind, Captain.

Soon, it will become
so powerful that none of us will be able to resist it.
There's nothing we can do about it.
We have nine minutes, fifty three seconds to power zero.
There is, of course, a logical alternative.

Kang's wife is, after all,
our prisoner.
It has rarely been done because of the danger involved.

If the transportee should materialise inside a
solid object, a deck or wall.
No one can guarantee the actions of another.

Your automatic setting is laid in,
Captain.

When transporter is energised, you will have
eight seconds to get to the pads.
You'll know in seven point nine seconds, Captain.
Those who hate and fight must stop themselves, Doctor.

All fighting must end, Captain, to weaken the alien before our
dilithium crystals are gone.
The cessation of violence appears to have weakened it, Captain.
I suggest that good spirits might make an effective weapon.
Forward phasers locked and ready to fire, sir.
What's Chekov's grudge against the Klingons?

Circuits are in, but systems just aren't
responding.
Four hundred of my crew dead.

You are now prisoners of the Klingon Empire
against which you have committed a wanton act of war!

For three years, the Federation and the Klingon Empire have been
at peace.
A treaty we have honoured to the letter.
Were the screams of my crew imaginary?

We shall
be happy to examine it.
We have wondered when you would begin.

You lured my ship into
ambush by a false Klingon distress call.

You will tell us why with the
proper persuasion.

I don't propose to spend the rest of my life on this ball of dust
arguing your fantasies.
Instruct your transporter room to beam us aboard.
But we understand the habits of yours.

I
shall torture you to death one by one until your noble captain cries
enough.
And you volunteer to join him.

I will kill one hundred hostages at
the first sign of treachery.

A Klingon would never have
surrendered.
Order everybody in this area to be transported up.
There are still survivors aboard my ship.
My wife, Mara, and my science officer.

When I take this ship, I'll have Kirk's head
stuffed and hung on his cabin wall.
No, they wish to question us, learn our strength, our plans.

Capture of the
Enterprise will give us knowledge to end this war quickly.

The bulk of your crew
trapped, your ship racing from this galaxy at wild speeds.
How did I perform this sabotage, Kirk?
I have captured your engineering section.

I now control this
ship's power and life-support systems.

I have deprived all areas except our
own.
You will die of suffocation in the icy cold of space.

What power is
it that supports our battle yet starves our victory?

Interrupt
it at their main life-support couplings.
She is a victim of war, Captain.
Mara, you're alive, and you bring us a prize.
What have they done to you, Mara?
Are you out of your mind?

What
have they done to you?

(sees the torn tunic) I see why the human beast
did not kill you.
No doubt you will reassemble after I have hacked you to bits!
Klingons kill for their own purposes.
We need no urging to hate humans.

But for the present, only
a fool fights in a burning house.
Who are the guests, by the way?

Captain, we've not been able to get through to Starfleet
Command.

All subspace frequencies have been blocked, and there's too
much radiation coming from that Klingon ship.

It's a hazard to the
vicinity.
I would if I could, sir.
They've gone to warp nine, by themselves!
Three hundred and ninety two trapped below decks.
The doors and bulkheads won't budge.
She's a projectile at warp nine.
And don't ask me what's holding her together.

There's no use trying to free those men down
below.

The phaser torches, they won't cut through the bulkheads, nor
the doors, nor the decks.
There's something happened to the metal.

I'm there now, sir, and you never saw such a fine collection of
antiques in your life.

(spots a special sword amongst the
ordinary ones.)
Any signs of those devils, Mister Sulu?

I don't know how
many more of those Klingons are around, but we'll split up here and try
to make it back to the bridge.
We should have left those fuzz-faced goons in the transporter.

Now they can study the Enterprise, add our
technology to theirs, change the balance of power.
Keep your Vulcan hands off me.

Your feelings
might be hurt, you green-blooded half-breed!
Have we forgotten how to defend ourselves?
But, Captain, I didn't do it.
Everything just came on by itself.

The ship's dilithium crystals are
deteriorating.
In twelve minutes, we'll be totally without engine power.
Now that's something the Klingons would understand.
It's the alien that's done this.

We're in its power, our people
and yours.
Even if it could work, she may be leading you into a trap.

But she can't guarantee that Kang will stop to listen, right,
Mister Spock?
I'm fit and ready for action.

The
Klingons almost did me in once.
I'm out to even the score.
It's them or us, isn't it?
What will they do to us?

I've heard of their atrocities, their
death camps.

They will torture us for our scientific and military
information.
They will kill us before we can act.
We are forty against four hundred.
Enemy numbers are the same as ours.
They appear to be controlled from another location.

Also unable
to affect ship's course for return to our empire.

We are hunters, Captain, tracking
and taking what we need.

There are poor planets in the Klingon systems,
we must push outward if we are to survive.
I will take you to Kang.
I will add my voice to yours.
Still no contact with Starfleet Command, sir.
No contact with Starfleet as yet, sir.
Could the Klingons be doing something?
Captain, reports coming in from the lower decks.

Almost four hundred crewmen are trapped down
there, sir.
Captain, why would, why would Chekov believe he has a brother?

There are more wounded men requiring
your attention.

Four thousand throats may be cut in one night by a running
man.
Layout and specifications of the Enterprise, Commander.
A ship that is headed towards the end of the galaxy?
Alien life force onboard is composed of pure energy.
(echoy voice and a huge shadow on the wall) Are you from the spaceship Enterprise?
I sing, I dance, I play all variety of games, and I'm a good loser, a very good loser.
Please, sir, try to bear that in mind.
Now, would you please accompany me?
I'm sure you've never heard of us.
Millennia ago, just before it went nova, we managed to escape.
Our leader liked Plato's ideas Plato, Platonius.
In fact, our present philosopher-king, Parmen, sometimes calls us Plato's children, although we sometimes think of ourselves more as Plato's stepchildren.
They deserve better than to die.
His mind will find me anyhow.
The others will kill each other trying to take his place.
Anything you want, Just ask me.
I think I should tell you that
Well, just that I never knew any people like you existed.
What do you mean, like me?
I thought you were talking about my size, because they make fun of me for my size.
But, to answer your question, I'm the only one without it.
I was brought here as the court buffoon.
That's why I'm everybody's slave and I have to be ten places at once, and I never do anything right.
As far as I know it just comes to you sometime after you're born.
They say I'm a throwback, and I am, and so are you.
You know, I believe you are.
Listen, where you come from, are there a lot of people without the power and my size?
Marking time to the rhyme with his hoof, with his hoof.
I'm ashamed to be a Platonian.
They were treating you the same way they treat me.
Just like me, only you fight them.
All the time, I thought it was me, my mind that couldn't move a pebble.
They even told I was lucky they bothered keep me around at all, and I believed them.
The arms and legs of everybody's whim.
Look down, don't meet their eyes.
These great people, they were gods to me.
But you showed me what they really are.
And now I know, don't you see.
It's not me, it's not my size, it's them!
This is the best thing for them.
I'm going to cut their I'm going to cut them.
Parmen first, and they'll all get infected.
But this time, listen, whatever they say, don't save them.
At least let me give them a taste of what they gave me.
Please, they're going to kill you anyway.
That's the first time anybody ever thought of my life before his own.
I should have told you when you first came here that they were going to kill you.
Because I knew, but I was afraid.
Anything I can do to help, you just tell me.
No, not until we came to this planet.
It was exactly six months and fourteen days after we got here that they started pushing me around.
Not that I'm afraid or anything, but will it hurt much?
You mean the same thing that kept me from having the power made me a dwarf?
Do you know, Parmen says each has his own separate power frequency, because before when they've tried to combine their powers, and use them together, it never worked.
Not after what they've done to me.
You think that's what I want?
Just lie around like a big blob of nothing and have things done for me?
I want to move around for myself.
If I'm going to laugh or cry, I want do it for myself.
You can keep your precious power.
All I ask is one thing.
If you do make it out of here, take me with you.
Just drop me any place they never heard of kironide or Platonius.
I could have had your power, but I didn't want it.
I could have had your place right now, but the sight of you and your Academicians sickens me.
Despite your brains, you're the most contemptible things that ever lived in this universe.
Who are the inhabitants of this planet?
Bones, I can't understand why a simple cut like that could become so serious.
This psychokinetic power of yours, how long have you had it?
That's why you have no resistance?
Get her out of orbit and into space.
Then there's nothing you can do but batten down and weather.
Parmen's mind is not (something flies past them very fast) Watch it!
He's not only throwing around furniture, he's tearing up the Enterprise as well.
I think you'll find the orbit lock is broken as well.
Assess damage and repair whatever is necessary.
Oh, thank you, we must return to the ship.
Well, in that case, we'll stay.
Alexander, are there other Platonians like you?
Who don't have the psychokinetic ability.
Alexander, where I come from, size, shape, or colour makes no difference, and nobody has the power.
That might not be easy should Parmen die.
This utopia of theirs is one of the best-kept secret in the galaxy.
Screening themselves from our sensors, locking us into orbit.
All this adds up to a pattern.
If ever there was a time to get out of here, it is now.
The turbulence hit you that hard?
Did you get up into space?
I would like to know why the ship's instrumentation and weaponry is frozen, and why the Enterprise is locked in orbit.
Parmen, I've talked to the engineer aboard the ship.
I want this ship released immediately.
You don't know the meaning of the word.
Guests aren't treated like common prisoners.
Parmen is not concerned with my dignity or safety.
Has the Enterprise been released yet?
Has the Enterprise been released yet?
Then good day, and thank you for the presents.
And you consider yourself a disciple of Plato?
And if his mind isn't strong enough, he gets torn apart like Alexander.
We don't use our weapons for the kind of brutality you practice.
They don't want to force you.
We're not leaving until McCoy is released.
No matter what he tries to
Being your slave, what should I do but tend upon the hours and times of your desire?
I have no precious time at all to spend, nor services to do, till you
No matter what he makes me say or do, the answer's no.
Is this your utopia, your grand vision of the future?
Can you do anything for him?
My muscles are sore, that's all.
Which just goes to prove that there's no such thing as a perfect solution.
He'd let us beam up to the Enterprise, and plunge the ship back into the atmosphere.
Because, if he killed us outright in front of you, you'd retaliate.
Bones, I know you're trying to do the right thing, but if any one of us escaped, Parmen knows Starfleet would never let this planet go unpunished.
Sacrifice yourself by agreeing to stay, and you sign our death warrant.
In that case, what's the point in you dying too, Alexander?
Listen, we haven't given up, and there may be something you can do to help.
Did the Platonians always have this power?
Bones, I think it'd be a good idea if you took a reading of Alexander's blood.
You still have a tricorder reading of Parmen's blood, don't you?
And if our theory works out, we've got a weapon.
McCoy, there must be a quick way of building up a concentration of kironide in our blood.
There are thirty eight of them.
Give us double the concentration in Parmen's bloodstream.
You could conceivably take Parmen's place and run the whole planet.
I guess we weren't sufficiently entertaining.
Spock, do you feel any effect of the kironide shot?
So did l. Let's try a simple test.
Concentrate on raising this plate of fruit.
You have to convince the doctor first.
That's the way they want you to feel.
It makes them think that they're alive.
Try not to think of them.
You're half dead, all of you!
We may disappear tomorrow, but at least we're living now, and you can't stand that, can you?
You're half crazy because there's nothing inside.
And you have to torture us to convince yourselves you're superior.
The next one of you that tries any trick will get hurt.
Not only do we have your psychokinetic abilities, but at twice your power level.
Do you want to be like him?
To us, killing is murder, even for revenge.
But there will be other starships.
Just remember, we can recreate that power in a matter of hours, so don't try anything.
You're very good at making speeches, Parmen.
Just make sure that this one sinks in.
Mister Scott, prepare to beam us up.
I have a little surprise for you.
Whom among you is the physician?
Ever since our arrival here on Platonius.
No, not if they're embedded in the unconscious.
We haven't had any pressing need for the medical arts.
You see, while still on Sahndara, we instituted a mass eugenics programme.
Pared down to a population of thirty eight, we're perfect for our utopia.
We're bred for contemplation and self-reliance.
How old would you say I am?
Well, anyway, you're off by two thousand years.
I'm two thousand three hundred years old.
I was only a hundred and seventeen, and he was a hundred and twenty eight.
So you see, we scarcely have to move anymore, let alone work.
A break in the skin or a cut can be fatal.
I don't know how I can ever thank you, not only for Platonius, but for myself.
Alexander, show our guests to the south wing.
Gentle spacemen, we are eternally in your debt.
Please accept them as tokens of our gratitude.
They stem from the very source of our inspiration.
To our noble captain, the shield carried by Pericles, as a symbol of gallant leadership.
To our silent and cerebral Mister Spock, this kithara to pluck music, to soothe his ever-active brow.
And lastly, to the physician Doctor McCoy, who saved Platonius and my spouse, this ancient collection of Greek cures, penned by Hippocrates himself.
Parmen, let's get on with it.
Well, what happened to that leg?
This should have been attended to immediately.
Well, we're certainly going to try.
Let me give you a hypo to ease the pain.
I'll let you know when I have the results.
And from now on, it would be better if I handled the instruments without your help.
Neither do I, but it has.
How do I knock out an infection when the tricorder doesn't show any information on Platonius bacteria?
All I can do, and this is going to take time, is to try to match his bugs with a known strain and hope.
I think I'd better wait until the fever breaks.
The infection's begun to drain already.
He may still need the ship's medical stores.
I don't want to go, but I can't help myself.
I'm very sorry, but that's impossible.
They're going to keep me here no matter what.
Don't do this to him, Parmen!
And we've had too much of yours.
I'll never get me to stay here.
You can't force emotion out of him.
There is no medicine that can help him.
He'll have to come through this himself.
The release of emotions, Mister Spock, is what keeps us healthy.
Parmen has promised me you'll be safe.
Then why wouldn't Alexander have the same power as the others?
You won't even know it happened.
Parmen possesses the highest order of psychokinetic ability, and Alexander the lowest, in the same environmental conditions.
I'll run both their blood samples through for a full comparative test on the tricorder.
The one significant difference between Parmen's blood and Alexander's is a concentration of kironide, broken down by pituitary hormone.
It'll take some doing, but it is possible.
Even if the kironide reaches the desired effect, it still may not help us get out of here.
Since the kironide's broken down and injected directly into his bloodstream, it should work on him as well as us.
Better in fact, because he's acclimated.
I'll do whatever you want me to do.
I'll stay and serve you, but stop it!
Is there anything you can do?
Philosopher kings have no need of titles.
You are mistaken, I assure you.
Allow me to remind you that I am the head of this principality.
Guests do not come barging in here, making demands and issuing orders.
Do not take that tone with me.
In my own defence, allow me to say that my illness was more profoundly disturbing that I myself realised.
I am sure that you, too, have been out of sorts and have been driven to fits of temper and rage.
Unlike you, however, what I think and feel, whether for good or ill, is instantly translated into reality.
So please, find it in your heart to forgive me.
But there is one final request.
After my nearly fatal infection, it has become obvious to us all that we cannot afford to be without a skilled physician.
Therefore we should like you, Doctor McCoy, to remain.
Your duties will be extraordinarily light.
You'll be free to read, meditate, conduct research, whatever you like.
We should like to keep it cordial, but we are determined to have you stay, Doctor.

Cancel Red Alert but maintain increased security.
Please update our subspace report to Starfleet to include security search, results negative.
Presumably the same way she got on.
Lieutenant, we are not engaged in gambling.
We are proceeding in the only logical way to return to the place they were last seen, and factually ascertain whether or not they still live.
I would calculate fourteen point eight seven minutes, Mister Scott.
No, but the method is fascinating.

A force that could hurl us nine hundred and ninety point seven light years away and at that distance still be able to sabotage our main source of energy will not be waiting around to be taken into custody.
As I recall the pattern of our fuel flow, there is an access tube leading to the matter-antimatter reaction chamber.
Still, it is there, and it might be possible to shut off the fuel at that point.
Unless a solution is found quickly, that fate awaits all of us.
You spoke of the feel of the ship being wrong.
I note it, Mister Scott, without necessarily understanding it.
I propose to run an analysis through the ship's computers, comparing the present condition of the Enterprise with her ideal condition.
We have twelve minutes and twenty seven seconds.
I suggest you do whatever you can in the service crawlway, while I make the computer study.
Mister Scott, I suggest you refrain from any further subjective descriptions.
You now have ten minutes and nineteen seconds in which to perform your task.
You now have ten minutes and ten seconds.
Please get on with the job.
Lieutenant Uhura, you are monitoring the magnetic force?
Please do not take your eyes off of it.
Lieutenant Rahda, arm the pod jettison system.
Mister Scott, what is your situation?
You have eight minutes, forty one seconds.
Computer, for outphase condition, will reverse field achieve closure?
Reverse polarity on your magnetic probe.
You were correct in your feel.
The Enterprise was put through a molecular transporter and reassembled slightly out of phase.
Reverse polarity should seal the incision.
Mister Scott, you have accomplished your task.
What is it in you humans
That requires an overwhelming display of emotion in a situation such as this?
Two men pursue the only reasonable course of action indicated, and yet you
Feel that something else is necessary.
I had the same misgivings about you.
We returned and picked up your life form readings only a moment ago.
From where this brain had the power to send the Enterprise.
Nine hundred and ninety point seven light years across the galaxy.
What a remarkable culture this is.
To do the job of defence, the computer projected a replica of the only image available.
However, she was evidently highly intelligent.
I meant what happened to us?
Security sweeps of all decks are negative, Mister Spock.
How did she get off the ship, sir?
Mister Spock what are the chances of the captain and the others being alive?
Magnetic force indicator jumping, Mister Spock.
Magnetic force has dropped to normal, sir.
The opportunity to explore so young a planet is an incredible bit of luck, Captain.
Captain, this tremor we felt, if that's what it was, it's certainly like no seismic disturbance I've ever felt before.
I got a reading of almost immeasurable power, but it's not there any more.
The reading I got had nothing to do with a seismic force.
And I haven't seen any evidence that there ever has been any rainfall.
I've come here to study them.
You been talking to my friends?
You're, you're the woman on the Enterprise.
I want to have a conference about sharing your food and water.
Jim, did you see what I saw?
What the devil does that mean, Jim?
Could it be the Enterprise hit the planet?
If the Enterprise has been destroyed, you know how long we can survive.
Is it possible the vegetation could absorb the water directly from the air?
Sulu's picked up an organism that's almost a virus, like a a plant parasite.
It's the nearest biological form of life I can find.
Jim, I just got a life form reading of tremendous intensity.
All levels were normal, then I get this biological surge of life form registering.
Jim, every cell in his body's been disrupted.
Whatever it is, it has a mighty high melting point.
This whole planet must be made up of this substance, covered over by top soil.
Well, I guess a tomb of rocks is the best we can provide for D'Amato.
It would be worse if he had company.
Until we know what killed him, none of us are safe.
In fact, nothing about this planet makes sense.
Are you suggesting this might be an artificial planet?
Well, all I know is she almost made a ghost out of Sulu.
His shoulder, where she touched it, every cell's been disrupted.
If she'd really gotten a good grip on him, Jim.
There's a layer of necrotic tissue a few cells thick.
A normal wound would heal quickly.
Jim, what kind of power must she have?
Captain, I'm getting no life form register.
That would give a mechanical reading.
Is the power level still holding, Jim?
You think we're being invited in?
The women match our chromosome patterns after they touch us.
The previous ships probably spread the disease all through their people.
The supply ship that she was waiting for never came.
All these thousands of years, she's been waiting to greet people who were dead.
You are Lieutenant D'Amato, Senior Geologist.
I am for you, Lieutenant D'Amato.
That is the emergency overload bypass, which engages almost instantaneously.
A wise precaution, considering it takes the antimatter longer to explode once the magnetic flow fails.
I am for you, Mister Watkins.
You were born on the planet Earth.
You are Captain James T. Kirk, commander of the Enterprise.
You must not penetrate this station.
I am for James T. Kirk.
But you are my match, James Kirk.
Then I will live as one, even to the structure of your cells, the arrangement of chromosomes.
After your long journey, I'm sorry to give you only a recorded welcome, but we who have guarded the outpost for you will be dead by the time you take possession of this planet.
I am the last of our advanced force left alive.
Too late the physicians discovered the cause of this sickness that kills us.
In creating this planet, we have accidentally produced a deadly organism.
I have awaited the regular supply ship from home for medical assistance, but I doubt now whether it will arrive in time.
I will set the outpost controls on automatic.
The computer will selectively defend against all life forms but our own.
My fellow Kalandans, I, Losira, wish you well.
(a woman in yellow uniform) Mister Spock.
No debris of any kind, sir.
If the planet had broken up, there'd be some sign.
But what bothers me is the stars, Mister Spock.
Now here's a replay of the star pattern just before the explosion.
But somehow I'd say that in a flash we've been knocked one thousand light years away from where we were.
Already plotted and laid in, sir.
We're holding warp eight point four, sir.
If we can maintain it, our estimated time of arrival is eleven and one half solar hours.
Mister Spock, speed is increased to warp eight point eight.
Mister Spock, our speed has increased to warp eight point nine and still climbing.
Mister Spock, we're at warp eleven point two and accelerating.
I'll jettison the pod at the first sign of trouble.
Six seconds, five seconds, four seconds, three seconds, two seconds.
Warp thirteen point nine and dropping.
What kind of earthquakes do they have in this place?
The Enterprise must have blown up.
That would explain the high radiation readings, wouldn't it, Captain?
Once in Siberia there was a meteor so great that it flattened whole forests and was felt as far away as
Captain, I was making a standard magnetic sweep.
From zero, I suddenly got a reading that was off the scale.
Then, a reverse of polarity and now I get nothing.
I've never seen anything like this reading.
Like a door opened and then closed again.
What a terrible way to die.
Doctor, how can you joke about it?
You remember on Janus Six, the silicon creatures
Beings intelligent enough to have destroyed the Enterprise?
The basic substance of this planet is an alloy of diburnium-osmium.
But Captain, where are the people who made it?
I'll take the first watch, sir.
Where did you get this information?
The captain will want to talk to you.
I don't want to have to kill a woman.
Don't let her touch you, Captain!
How can such people be, Captain?
Such evil and she's so, so beautiful.
How could it happen so fast?
Captain, I'm happy the way it turned out.
But Captain, how does she know about us?
(there's a whining sound) Phaser on overload!
Captain, I'm getting that strange magnetic sweep again, from zero to off the scale.
I'd rather be on the Enterprise, sir.
Captain, we can no longer protect each other.
The point is, it shouldn't have hurled us anywhere.
Why, it should have destroyed us immediately, vaporised us.
What you're saying is that the planet didn't blow up, and the captain and the others, they're still alive!
But even at that it'll take a while to get there.
And maybe a wee bit more.
I'll sit on the warp engines myself and nurse them.
Mister Spock, the ship feels wrong.
I know it doesn't make sense.
Instrumentation reads correct, but the feel is wrong.
It's something I can't quite put into words.
Watkins, check the bypass valve on the matter/antimatter reaction chamber.
I didn't ask you to check the board, lad.
I didn't see it happen, but his last words were a warning cry about some strange woman.
You mean that one of the people who threw us a thousand light years away from that planet is on board and killing our people?
I sent him in to check the matter-antimatter reactor.
There are no exposed circuits there.
It couldn't have been anything he touched.
Reduce speed until I locate the trouble.
Aye, Mister Spock, and I found out why.
The emergency bypass control of the matter-antimatter integrator is fused.
There's no way to get at them.
We should reach maximum overload in about fifteen minutes.
Those few seconds will not make any difference, Mister Spock, because you and I and the rest of the crew will no longer be here to bandy it back and forth.
This thing is going to blow up
And there's nothing in the universe can stop it.
And there's no question it's deliberate.
Well, it's fused, all right, but it would take all the power of our main phaser banks to do it.
I find nothing interesting in the fact that we're about to blow up.
Whatever did this is still aboard this ship.
I fail to understand why you cancelled the security alert.
There's a service crawlway, but it's not meant to be used while the integrator operates.
Any matter that comes in contact with antimatter triggers the explosion.
And I'm not even sure a man can live in the crawlway in the energy stream of the magnetic field that bottles up the antimatter.
What have we got to lose?
But I'll do it, Mister Spock.
I know every millimetre of that system.
I'll do whatever has to be done.
I don't expect you to understand it.
Mister Spock, we don't have time for that.
I hope Mister Spock knows what he's doing.
I've sealed off the aft end of the service crawlway, and I've positioned explosive separator charges to blast me clear of the ship if I rupture the magnetic bottle.
I'm so close to the flow now it feels like ants crawling all over my body.
The ship's not structured to take that speed for any length of time.
I'm starting to open the access panel now.
If the magnetic flow jumps, you must jettison me.
Will not hold more than two seconds if I rupture the field.
I've removed the access plate, and I've got static electric charges dancing on the instruments.
Looks like an aurora borealis in there.
There's so much disturbance that any attempt to get at the flow would rupture the magnetic field.
I know what time it is.
I don't need a blooming' cuckoo clock.
I'm going to try to cut through the magnetic flow.
But if the probe doesn't precisely match the magnetic flow, there'll be an explosion.
I have no time for theory.
I'm doing the best I can!
You might at least say thank you.
Doctor Sanchez is conducting an autopsy right now.
You asked for an autopsy report.
It's only preliminary, but the cause of death seems to have been cellular disruption.
It's as though every cell in the body had been individually blasted from inside.
Doctor Sanchez has ruled that possibility out, sir.
Well, the pattern of cellular disruption was the same, but as to the cause, well your guess is as good as mine.
But, Mister Scott, the board shows correct.
This is the matter-antimatter integrator control.
Mister Scott, there's a strange woman who knows the entire plan of the Enterprise.
Comparison co-ordinates too complex for immediate readout.
Transporter factor M7 reassembled outphase point zero zero zero nine.

They're rearranged to a degree, plus a few I've

That Be Your Last Battlefield

Now, I've enriched the oxygen content of his blood

And I must say his recuperative

That Be Your Last Battlefield

Well, touch and go there for a minute, but you're out of danger

That Be Your Last Battlefield

Well, however we view him, Captain, he's certainly no ordinary

Lokai, I don't know what's normal for you exactly, but if I

That Be Your Last Battlefield

That Be Your Last Battlefield

ep_title:

That Be Your Last Battlefield

That Be Your Last Battlefield

My need gave me the right to use
the ship.

text:
I would've returned the ship as soon as
I

ep_title:

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
First you condemn and then
attack.

ep_title:

That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I will answer no more questions.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Made so by your vindictive
cross-examinations.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I will answer no more questions.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I will not return to Cheron with him, to a land of murdering
oppressors!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
He raided our homes, tore us from our
families, herded us together like cattle and then sold us as slaves!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Yes, just education enough to serve the master race.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Why should a slave show mercy to the enslaver?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

That Be Your Last Battlefield

ep_title:

That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Free to live our lives in equality and dignity?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
My only
crime is that I failed.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: To that I do plead guilty.

ep_title:

That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
And not in ten times ten thousand years by your
thinking.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: To you, we are a loathsome breed who will never be ready.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Genocide for my people is the plan for your utopia.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I know you and all those with whom you're plotting to take power
permanently.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
When I return to Cheron, you will understand what power
is.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I will have armies of followers.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Captain, I led revolutionaries, not criminals.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I will not return to Cheron.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Captain, you must guarantee me
sanctuary.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: All of you must help me.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: What a fool I am, expecting help from someone like you.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I warned you of his treachery.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Your words promise justice for
all.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Yes, well, I have learned to wait for actions.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I shall wait to see it dispensed.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
And I know from my actions you must all think me a volcanic
hothead, erupting lava from my nostrils at danger signals that are only
figments of my imagination.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
But believe me, my friends, there can be no
moment when I can have my guard down where such as Bele is present.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I act the madman out of the anger and frustration he
forces upon me, and thereby prove his point that I am a madman.

ep_title:

That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Ah, Mister Chekov, therein lies my lack of ability to alert you
and your captain to the real threat of someone like Bele.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You see, you
are from the planet Earth.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: There is no persecution on your planet.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
How
can you understand my fear,
my apprehension, my degradation, my suffering?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: You have read about it in history, I see.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
How can I make your
flesh know how it feels to see all those who are like you, and only
because they are like you, despised, slaughtered, and even worse,
denied the simplest bit of decency that is a living being's right?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Do
you know what it would be like to be dragged out of your hovel into a
war on another planet?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
A battle that will serve your oppressor and
bring death to you and your brothers?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: So this is justice after Ariannus!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You have signed my death
warrant.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I warned you what to expect.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Will you continue to let this
mockery of justice go on?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: If you are partisans of justice, prove it!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: What do you do, carry justice on your tongues?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You will beg for
it, but you won't fight or die for it.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: You useless pieces of bland flesh.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I'll take you with me, you
half-black.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Remember, Captain, political sanctuary is my right.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Honour that right, or the fight will go on and your ship will
burn up.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: It served me long and durably.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Unfortunately, the strain of
arduous pursuit has exceeded even its advanced qualities.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I was just
able to complete this trip and disembark in time, or I would have
disintegrated in space with it.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
It was sheathed in special materials that rendered it
invisible.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
He has taken refuge aboard this
ship.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I am here to claim him.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Claim is
undoubtedly an unfortunate word.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I am chief officer of the Commission on Political Traitors.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Lokai
was tried and convicted of treason, but had escaped.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Well, Lokai, it's a pleasure to see you
again.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
This time I'm sure our joining will be of a more permanent
nature.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Captain, you are to be congratulated.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Never before has Lokai been
rendered so quiescent.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
And you see how this killer repays you, as he repays all his
benefactors.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
We took them into our hearts, our
homes.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: You were the product of our love!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: And you repaid us with murder.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: That was changed thousands of years ago.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Yes, you were free, if you knew how to use your freedom.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You were
free enough to slaughter and to burn all the things that had been
built!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: There is an order in things.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: He asked for utopia in a day.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: You insane, you filthy little plotter of ruin.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You vicious
subverter of every decent thought.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Oh, you're coming back to pay for
your crimes!

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Captain, it is imperative that you return Lokai to Cheron for
judgment.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Captain, I hope you will be sensible.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Since I am without a vessel to return to Cheron, I insist that
you take us there immediately.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
That will not be satisfactory, not at all
satisfactory.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: We're on the way to Cheron.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Captain, this ship is now under my
direction.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
For fifty thousand of your terrestrial years,
I have been pursuing Lokai through the galaxy.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I have not travelled
this far, this long, only to give him up.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
This ship goes where my will
drives it.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You're on the way to
judgment, to final punishment.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Everywhere he's gone, he's
been helped to escape.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
On every planet he's found fools who bleed for
him and shed tears for the oppressed one.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
But there is no escape for
you on this ship.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: And we are both going to Cheron.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You cannot change the course of
this ship any more than you can change me.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
This ship goes where I want
it to go.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Your phasers are ineffective against our shields.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: No, this ship is going to Cheron.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
My will
now controls this, and nothing can break it.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: You can no more destroy this ship than I can change colour.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Captain, I am happy to have you complete your mission of mercy to
the planet Ariannus.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
It was madness to interfere with such a worthwhile
endeavour.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
But, if you will, upon completion, please take me and my
traitorous captive to Cheron.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: The ship's course is now in your control.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Putting the matter into the hands of your
Starfleet Command is, of course, the proper procedure.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
How long will it
be before we hear from them, Captain?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Well, then, let us drink to their wise solution to our problem.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Gentlemen, we are discussing a question of degree.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Surely,
stealing a shuttlecraft cannot be equated with the importance of
murdering thousands of people.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: One thing we are agreed on is that Lokai is a criminal.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: As always, Lokai has managed to gain allies.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Even if they don't recognise themselves as being such.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Yes, he
will evade, delay, and escape again and in the process put thousands of
innocent beings at each other's throats, getting them to kill and maim
for a cause which they have no stake in, but which he will force them
to violently espouse by twisting their minds with his lies, his
loathsome accusations and his foul threats.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
It is obvious to the most simpleminded that Lokai is of an
inferior breed.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: I am black on the right side.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Lokai is white on the right side.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
All of his people are white on
the right side.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Commander Spock, I am delighted that Vulcan was saved, but you
cannot expect Lokai and people like him to act with self-discipline any
more than you can expect a planet to stop orbiting its sun.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: You mean like both of you?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
I once heard that on some of your planets people believe they are
descended from apes.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: There is nothing I would like more.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
The directional control and the self-destruct, Captain, are both
burnt out.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Now can we go to Cheron without any more discussion?

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
We've got your kind penned in on Cheron
into little districts, and it's not going to change.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
You've combed the
galaxy and come up with nothing but mono-coloured trash, do-gooders and
bleeding hearts.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
If you listen to his legalistic trickery, I shall have to destroy
this ship and everybody aboard.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Your band of murderers did this.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Voice and code verified and correct.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text: Voice and code one B, two B, three verified and correct.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Awaiting final code for thirty
second countdown.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
Awaiting final code for thirty
second countdown.

ep_title:
Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield

Let
That Be Your Last Battlefield
text:
twenty nine, twenty eight, twenty seven,
(break) twenty five seconds,
